records.text: A few years ago Alix Harrow's A SPLINDLE SPLINTERED, a meta-story about Sleeping Beauty, was nominated in this category.  T. Kingfisher's THORNHEDGE is another Sleeping Beauty revision that takes a different angle: our POV character is Toadling, the fairy who now lives in the forest surrounding the castle and spends a lot of her time in toad form.  She watches passers-by with suspicion, hoping they don't notice the castle hidden behind the hedges... then after a few centuries a knight arrives in search of the lost castle. The story's approach is reminiscent of Gaiman's story "Snow, Glass, Apples", but brighter and in the end it's a sweet-hearted story, another great one from Kingfisher.#Thornhedge #TKingfisher #SleepingBeauty #NeilGaiman #SnowGlassApples

records.text: MAMMOTHS AT THE GATES is book #4 in the Singing Hills series of novellas by Nghi Vo. This is a great fantasy series, set in a legendary Asia that might be Vietnamese or Chinese. In this one, the story-gathering monk Chih has returned home to the Singing Hills abbey, to rest and to visit their former travelling buddy, the intelligent bird Almost Brilliant. Almost Brilliant has been busy hatching an egg and raising the chick.  But things are different at the abbey: beloved abbott Cleric Thien has died, the abbott's companion bird Myriad Virtues is grieving and turns up mutilated, and there are two war mammoths lurking at the gate, brought by Thien's former family who want to carry away his body.It's an engaging story with an ending that I found puzzling: I don't understandthe implications that it has for the world of the series.#MammothsAtTheGates #NghiVo

But things are different at the abbey: beloved abbott Cleric Thien has died, the abbott's companion bird Myriad Virtues is grieving and turns up mutilated, and there are two war mammoths lurking at the gate, brought by Thien's former family who want to carry away his body.It's an engaging story with an ending that I found puzzling: I don't understandthe implications that it has for the world of the series.#MammothsAtTheGates #NghiVo

records.text: A few years ago Alix Harrow's A SPLINDLE SPLINTERED, a meta-story about Sleeping Beauty, was nominated in this category.  T. Kingfisher's THORNHEDGE is another Sleeping Beauty revision that takes a different angle: our POV character is Toadling, the fairy who now lives in the forest surrounding the castle and spends a lot of her time in toad form.  She watches passers-by with suspicion, hoping they don't notice the castle hidden behind the hedges... then after a few centuries a knight arrives in search of the lost castle. The story's approach is reminiscent of Gaiman's story "Snow, Glass, Apples", but brighter and in the end it's a sweet-hearted story, another great one from Kingfisher.#Thornhedge #TKingfisher #SleepingBeauty #NeilGaiman #SnowGlassApples

records.text: MAMMOTHS AT THE GATES is book #4 in the Singing Hills series of novellas by Nghi Vo. This is a great fantasy series, set in a legendary Asia that might be Vietnamese or Chinese. In this one, the story-gathering monk Chih has returned home to the Singing Hills abbey, to rest and to visit their former travelling buddy, the intelligent bird Almost Brilliant. Almost Brilliant has been busy hatching an egg and raising the chick.  But things are different at the abbey: beloved abbott Cleric Thien has died, the abbott's companion bird Myriad Virtues is grieving and turns up mutilated, and there are two war mammoths lurking at the gate, brought by Thien's former family who want to carry away his body.It's an engaging story with an ending that I found puzzling: I don't understandthe implications that it has for the world of the series.#MammothsAtTheGates #NghiVo
